head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden ¶ 26/9/62. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to place at my disposal the remainder of the wages left available from the vote for 1862, being the ...

div.p: W62/6521, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to place at my disposal the remainder of the wages left available from the vote for 1862, being the sum of one thousand pounds Sterling, £1000, and that you will be pleased to sanction that it may be expended in ordinary wages and remuneration for occasional joblabor and that also any wages due for the third quarter of the year may be liquidated out of the above sum.
I beg further to solicit, that of the vote for publishing works on Australian plants transfer Australian plants a transfer to the amount of fifteen (£15) pounds Sterling may be made to the Storevote.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
&c &c &c
On 30 September 1862 the Under Secretary, J. Moore, minuted: 'This transfer was submitted to the Governor in Council yesterday and the authority will be issued so soon as the [...] is returned to the Chief Secretary.' M was informed of the transfer and replied on 30 September: 'Thankfully returned'.
